text: Sessions@AOL is a special avenue of programming conducted by AOL Music. Originally an AOL exclusive, Sessions@AOL can now also be seen as an avenue for non-AOL users as well. Sessions@AOL consists of exclusive and intimate (often acoustic or stripped down) performances of songs by popular musicians, including Westlife, Lady Gaga, Kanye West, Snoop Dogg, G-Unit, Coldplay, Avril Lavigne, Ashley Tisdale, Keane, The Killers, N.E.R.D., Slipknot, Linkin Park, Papa Roach, Blink 182, Fleetwood Mac, Green Day, Snow Patrol, Carrie Underwood, Backstreet Boys, My Chemical Romance, Thirty Seconds to Mars, Sean Paul, Thrice, Fort Minor, Simple Plan, Bond and Evanescence. Many artists also conduct interviews with the band member or performer. Audio performances from Sessions@AOL are often released as live performances on the commercial singles of artists or as exclusive downloads at the iTunes Store. ==Releases== ===Sessions @ AOL=== A live album featuring performances from artists such as Coldplay, Alicia Keys, Missy Elliott, Avril Lavigne, Jewel and the Roots was released by Atlantic Records in mid October 2003. ==See also== *AOL Radio ==References== ==External links== * US AOL Sessions * UK AOL Sessions Category:Fuse (TV channel) original programming Category:2000s American music television series Category:2010s American music television series Category:2003 American television series debuts Category:Live album series Category:2000s live albums Category:2010s live albums
title: Sessions@AOL
